section.p: This document is intended for committers who are packaging a release. It likely won't be of much use to anyone else.

If this is the first time you're doing a release you'll need to perform some setup.
Get a new version of the maven clover plugin: maven plugin:download -DartifactId=maven-clover-plugin -DgroupId=maven -Dversion=1.9.1
You might also need to specify the following properties to maven. You can do this with a build.properties file, in the project directory or in your home directory, or on the command line with the -D option.
maven.username=(your sf.net username) maven.scp.executable=(full path to a scp app if no "scp" on your path) maven.ssh.executable=(full path to a ssh app if no "ssh" on your path)
As an example, my setup is:
maven.username=yourgod maven.scp.executable=C:/programs/ssh/pscp.exe maven.ssh.executable=C:/programs/ssh/plink.exe
Also, since I am using putty I needed to manually connect to the server once to trust the host. You may need to do something similar for your ssh client. c:\programs\ssh\plink.exe -l yourgod projects.sourceforge.net

Now do this for each release:
Update the version number in pom.xml
Update the version number and release date in src/site/xdoc/index.xml
Update the version number and release date in src/changes/changes.xml
Build the zip maven clean assembly:assembly
Upload the two zip files to SourceForge following
these instructions
Add a new Group in SourceForge tracker system.
Assuming that everything has gone smoothly so far, make sure everything is checked in and tag the repository with a name like this "HtmlUnit-1dot1" that reflects the current build version.
Rebuild and redeploy the site documentation. maven site:deploy
Deploy this new version to the maven repository as described here.
